availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas A. Cheser (Washington County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Beeden Cheser and Charlotte H. Cheser. Married to Lucinda Hardin Cheser in Washington County, Kentucky, on April 19, 1860. Resident of Washington County in 1850. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Indicted by the Washington Circuit Court for the stabbing of John W. Hendricks in Washington County in 1861. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from July 27, 1862, to September 6, 1865. Reported as deserted on March 9, 1864. Returned to service on March 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 187B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 67.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film 000551244, p. 52.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 062.
